definition: to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: The next few years are many argue certainly that.
sentences.chinese: 未來幾年都非常多對罵是一定的了。

sentences.english: The rebellious singer is well-known for quarrelling and fighting with paparazzi.
sentences.chinese: 艾倫是位叛逆的歌手，曾和狗仔對罵打架。

sentences.english: The two of us stood in the middle of a large, open-plan office and let rip.
sentences.chinese: 我們兩個人站在一間大大的開放式辦公室中央對罵。

sentences.english: Two people started to yell, Jeff han feathers.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人開始對罵，韓志傑找碴。

sentences.english: The two men were shouting abuse, but she did her best to pour oil on the troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 那兩個男人大聲對罵，而她則盡力從中調解。

sentences.english: They spew vulgar epithets without quarter, sometimes touching off brawls.
sentences.chinese: 他們口無遮攔的對罵粗鄙不堪的綽號，有時挑起爭吵。

sentences.english: The two girls were calling each other names.
sentences.chinese: 兩個女孩正在相互對罵。

sentences.english: They set to after calling each other names.
sentences.chinese: 相互對罵之後，他們打起架來。

definition: to flip out/to act out violently
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
barrage (military)/"bullet screen", function which allows viewers to post on-screen comments in videos, movies etc in real time/danmaku (video game subgenre)
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
